issue.message: `commons-logging` defines classes that conflict with classes now provided by Android. Solutions include finding newer versions or alternative libraries that don't have the same problem (for example, for `httpclient` use `HttpUrlConnection` or `okhttp` instead), or repackaging the library using something like `jarjar`.

`httpclient` defines classes that conflict with classes now provided by Android. Solutions include finding newer versions or alternative libraries that don't have the same problem (for example, for `httpclient` use `HttpUrlConnection` or `okhttp` instead), or repackaging the library using something like `jarjar`.
Consider using `apply()` instead; `commit` writes its data to persistent storage immediately, whereas `apply` will handle it in the background
Not targeting the latest versions of Android; compatibility modes apply. Consider testing and updating this version. Consult the android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES javadoc for details.
A newer version of com.google.zxing:core than 3.3.2 is available: 3.4.1
A newer version of com.google.android.material:material than 1.9.0 is available: 1.10.0
A newer version of com.google.firebase:firebase-bom than 32.1.0 is available: 32.4.0
Add annotation processor to processor path using `annotationProcessor` instead of `implementation`
Add annotation processor to processor path using `testAnnotationProcessor` instead of `testImplementation`
Add annotation processor to processor path using `androidTestAnnotationProcessor` instead of `androidTestImplementation`
